projects.title: German with Nik: Voice-First German Learning AI App
projects.shortDescription: A mobile app offering personalized, voice-based German language learning through an AI assistant named Nik, making real-time conversational learning accessible and affordable.
projects.situation: The idea came from my own struggle with learning German after moving to Germany in 2023. Traditional classes and native speaker conversations weren't effective, which inspired the use of generative AI to build a truly interactive tutor.

research: Analyzed existing language learning apps and found they lacked real-time conversation learning
Conducted market analysis showing coaching costs of €100–€200+ per month
Gathered early feedback from Reddit that confirmed strong interest
strategy: Created a POC using ChatGPT that showed promising results
Defined user persona: Highly motivated language learners seeking affordable, interactive experiences
Established monetization model: Free trial + Subscription (Monthly/Yearly)
development: Designed system architecture: [User Voice Input] → STT (OpenAI Whisper-1) → LLM Agent (Groq LLAMA + RAG) → TTS → [Voice Output by Nik]
Built server using WebSocket-based Node.js with RAG using German lesson documents
Developed client using Expo React Native app
Released multiple versions with progressive improvements from basic flow to payment integration

impact: Achieved 85% download to install conversion rate
Optimized system performance with 2.5 sec overall latency
Established profitable economics with €10 monthly revenue per user vs €2 cost
lessons: Voice-first interfaces create more engaging language learning experiences
RAG significantly improves contextual accuracy in language tutoring
Latency optimization is critical for conversational applications
Free trial model works effectively for educational apps with clear value proposition

projects.title: Enterprise Banking Platform Transformation
projects.shortDescription: Strategic team alignment for financial technology scale, leading to accelerated delivery timelines and improved collaboration.
projects.situation: Platform and Solutions Teams were misaligned with different goals, creating delivery bottlenecks.

research: Conducted stakeholder interviews across teams to identify core friction points
Analyzed development workflows and team structures
strategy: Developed dual-track approach to platform and product development
Designed new team structure and collaboration framework
development: Implemented agile ceremonies to align roadmaps
Created shared KPIs between platform and product teams

impact: Improved platform quality with 40% fewer critical bugs
Enhanced team morale and reduced attrition by 30%
Strengthened customer relationships with more predictable releases
lessons: Organizational design is as critical as technical architecture
Executive sponsorship is essential for structural changes
Sharing context between teams is more valuable than rigid processes

projects.title: Self-Serve Identity Platform
projects.shortDescription: Built a self-service identity platform that reduced support tickets by 30% and transformed access management across internal and external users.
projects.situation: Identity changes and access requests relied on tenant admins and manual workflows, creating friction and ticket overhead.

research: Traced user journeys to identify pain points
Interviewed customers and admins about access management
strategy: Designed self-service portal for all identity management
Created approval workflows to maintain security
development: Implemented audit trails and compliance reporting

impact: Eliminated 2-5 day wait times for access changes
Created industry-standard experience comparable to Okta and Ping
lessons: Self-service requires clear guardrails and policies
Identity management is a key enabler of business agility
UX investment has exponential returns in identity products
